description: Coined from genesis, similarly to antithesis, antithetic. Ultimately from Ancient Greek γίγνομαι (gígnomai, “I come into being”). Surface analysis, gene +‎ -tic or genesis +‎ -etic.

examples: All evidence tends to this conclusion, that the sun is the prime genetic agent of earthquakes and of every other pluto-dynamic impulse which acts against the crust of the planet, and breaks or elevates any of its parts.

entries.meaning: (linguistics) Based on shared membership in a linguistic family.
examples: Chinese has borrowed several words from English, but it does not have a genetic relationship to English.

entries.meaning: (theology) Based on a shared membership in a religious family.
